item.title: Ok i need help from a good coder
item.dc:creator: @Zenzie Zenzie
item.description:
@Zenzie wrote:

if((itemUsed == ID1 && useWith == ID2)) // { sendMessage("You add strange chemical on the dagger"); deleteItem(ID1,getItemSlot(ID1), 1); deleteItem(ID2,getItemSlot(ID2), 1); addItem(ID3, 1); // dagger1 }
ID1 = item

ID2 = item to use on

ID3 = what you want to have added

item.source: Ok i need help from a good coder

item.title: Ok i need help from a good coder
item.dc:creator: @samuraiblood2 samuraiblood2
item.description:
@samuraiblood2 wrote:

if((itemUsed == item id && useWith == item id) || (itemUsed == item other item id && useWith == other item id)) { if(playerHasItemAmount(item id, amount)) { deleteItem(item id, getItemSlot(item id), 1); deleteItem(item id, getItemSlot(item id), 1); startAnimation(725); addItem(item id, 1); addSkillXP((1000*playerLevel[24]), 24); } else { sendMessage("Bla bla bla"); } }

EDIT: added something i just saw you didnt have in your code, it makes so if you use the other item on the first item itll do the same thing (its basicly reversed with the same actions)

Read full topic

UNDER

println_debug("Item: "+useWith+" used with item: "+itemUsed); println_debug("usedwithslot: "+usedWithSlot+" itemusedslot: "+itemUsedSlot+" usewith: "+useWith+" p4: "+p4+" itemused: "+itemUsed+" p6: "+p6); }

item.title: Ok i need help from a good coder
item.dc:creator: @wowomgdotcom wowomgdotcom
item.description:
@wowomgdotcom wrote:

Okay i want to make it so you use one item with another and you get a different item (like the dyeing concept) but instead of just that i want to make it so you have to have a certain item in your inventory to make the result item.
So lets say i want to make wizzy (g) robes so i get blue robes and a gold bar, but i have to have a chisel in my inventory to do it. Does anyone know what i can do?
This is the code im using.

} if((itemUsed == FIRST ITEM && useWith == SECOND ITEM)) { // deleteItem(FIRST ITEM, getItemSlot(FIRST ITEM), 1); deleteItem(SECOND ITEM, getItemSlot(SECOND ITEM), 1); startAnimation(725); addItem(RESULT ITEM, 1); addSkillXP((1000*playerLevel[24]), 24); }

Read full topic
